title: Kersti Kaljulaid
summary: Kersti Kaljulaid (Estonian pronunciation: [ˈkersti ˈkɑljuˈlɑi̯d]; born 30 December 1969) is an Estonian politician who served as the fifth president of Estonia, from 2016 to 2021. She was the first female head of state of Estonia since the country declared independence in 1918, as well as the youngest president, age 46 at the time of her election.[1]
